Ok everyone, I haven\'t checked in on this thread in a little while since I\'ve been busy with school. Some announcements:

1. The next update to the Space Station Parts Pack will be, at the latest, the end of next weekend, Mar. 19th.

2. The reason for the delay is a re-balancing effort that the team is undertaking. The parts are going to be made lighter, and will follow a universal weight standard of a half-ton per cubic meter. This will not only make the pack easier to use, since stations will no longer require ridiculous amounts of thrust to reach orbit, but it will also improve craft handling in orbit, which will be handy for module-to-module docking in the future. We will also be adjusting RCS fuel tank size and working with the plugins a bit more, partially to improve realism, and partially because lower weights will change RCS performance.

3. Eventually, Kosmos will not just be space station parts. Cardboard has already mentioned our next project after the station parts are finished, the Angara series of rockets. Here\'s a picture:

There\'s already been some work on the project, specifically, the main engine. I figure the first Angara parts will become available before the SSPP is fully complete. Beyond Angara, a few odds and ends are planned to fully outfit the packs into an all-purpose parts index, including Mun base equipment and deep-space Nerva-style engines.

I saw someone mention the need for a zip file for the pack. I\'ll go get on that.
there is a slight problem with the engine control algorithms for the mod as well currently. but once the slslight bug is fixed by coder awesome epic engines will be ready :D
on a side note. The rd-191\'s first flight. it is so beautiful.

That sounds awesome!

back to kosmos new, compliments, kosmos complains, kosmos troubleshooting, and serious kosmos suggestion ONLY posting.
